fullText: This Broadway revival of Tony Kushner's masterpiece, directed by Marianne Elliott, is nothing short of transcendent, a production that honors the scope and ambition of the playwright's vision while finding fresh ways to illuminate its themes.
dtliExcerpt: This Broadway revival of Tony Kushner's masterpiece, directed by Marianne Elliott, is nothing short of transcendent, a production that honors the scope and ambition of the playwright's vision while finding fresh ways to illuminate its themes.
bwwExcerpt: I'm here to tell you that your investment will come back to you in the capital gains of enlightenment and sublime entertainment. Director Marianne Elliott's riveting production, a transfer from London's National Theatre, which stars Andrew Garfield and Nathan Lane and had its official opening Sunday at Broadway's Neil Simon Theatre, is the kind of bracing total immersion in fierce, funny drama that is nutrition for both intellect and soul.
